results.title: Pruning practices at the Brooklyn Botanic Gardens
results.creator_credit: Stuart Chasmar and Centre for Mass Communication
results.brief_description: Shows how proper pruning produces healthy plants of good appearance. Demonstrates techniques of pruning deciduous and evergreen trees, roses, rhododendron, forsythia, lilac, hedges etc., and follows the growth of the plants through the year.

results.title: Protestant Christianity
results.brief_description: Protestantism represents the outcome of centuries of disagreement over doctrine and practice within the Catholic Church. Led by Martin Luther in 16th century western Europe, this spiritual revolution gained momentum and, under the helm of other Protestant leaders, thrived and grew into new factions around the world, especially in Europe and North America. Narrated by Ben Kingsley, this video also investigates the numerous denominations that developed over the centuries, including Calvinists, Baptists, Mennonites, Presbyterians, Puritans, Amish and Quakers.

results.title: Prostitute I am, common I'm not
results.brief_description: A revealing and honest film about five women who are prostitutes. They talk openly and intimately about themselves and their lives, telling why they do it, how they feel and how much they earn.

results.title: Prosthetic Head
results.brief_description: Prosthetic Head, is a computer-generated head that has real-time lip synching, speech synthesis, and facial expressions. Through a vision or sensor system, the Prosthetic Head will be able to acknowledge the presence and position of any physical body that approaches it and speak to the person who interrogates it.

results.title: Inversion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jay Hines, Seymour Schuster, College Geometry Project, University of Minnesota and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Geometric inversion is introduced and discussed to effect the solution of an apparently difficult problem involving the inscription of a chain of circles between two given circles, one inside the other. The final result, known as Steiner’s Porism, is forcefully illustrated in motion - “pop art” fashion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jay Hines, Seymour Schuster, College Geometry Project, University of Minnesota and International Film Bureau

results.title: Preparing your child for school. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glenn McIver, Trevor Lunn and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Part 1. Discussion is centered on helping children handle being separated from their parents, relating to other children and adults, gaining independence and responsibility in new situations and encouraging curiosity and confidence. Part 2. Encompasses a number of practical considerations which parents will find helpful in preparing their child for school, such as clothing, lunches and school bags.

results.title: Duke Nukem for Game Boy Color
results.brief_description: Duke Nukem’s world-saving exploits have attracted the attention of a new alien foe, the Zorgonites. They plan kidnap the smartest minds in the universe - including Duke’s - to power their hyper-intelligent war machine and conquer the universe. The game takes the player around the world and beyond to stop this from happening. A Game Boy Colour port of Duke Nukem II, much as been changed. For instance, the Zorgonites were originally called the Rigelatins. The levels, weapons, items, enemies, and bosses are almost completely different.

results.title: Regular homotopies in the plane. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William Hansard and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Uses computer-generated animation in order to illustrate the Whitney-Graustein theorem - two regular curves in the plane are regularly homotopic if, and only if, they have the same rotation number.

results.title: Prostate disease
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Merck, Sharp and Dohme and Special Broadcasting Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program looks at the early symptoms of prostate problems, how many men react to these and what men need to do to prevent prostate cancer. An excellent progam to encourage men to have check ups at an early stage of problems. Partly dramatised.
